intro: Trollius europaeus var. songoricus, commonly known as the Songaric goldcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features showy, bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller florets, creating a sun-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and wetlands. The flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
